raw_text: The patient is complaining from bilateral knee pain since five years. Two years ago, the pain increased. Plane X-ray was done showing advanced osteoarthritis grade 4. Non-steroidal anti-inflammatory was given for around one month with muscle relaxants showing mild improvement. She is now doing physiotherapy exercises to see again after two weeks.
refined_text: The patient has been complaining of bilateral knee pain for five years. Two years ago, the pain worsened. A plain X-ray was done, showing advanced grade 4 osteoarthritis. Non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs were given for about one month along with muscle relaxants, resulting in mild improvement. She is currently doing physiotherapy exercises and will be reassessed in two weeks.
translated_text: The patient has been complaining of bilateral knee pain for five years. Two years ago, the pain worsened. A plain X-ray was done, showing advanced grade 4 osteoarthritis. Non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs were given for about one month along with muscle relaxants, resulting in mild improvement. She is currently doing physiotherapy exercises and will be reassessed in two weeks.

json_data.history_of_illness: The patient has been experiencing bilateral knee pain for five years, with worsening pain two years ago.
json_data.imaging_results: Plain X-ray showing advanced grade 4 osteoarthritis
json_data.plan: Continue physiotherapy exercises, reassess in two weeks

reasoning: The patient presents with bilateral knee pain that has been ongoing for five years and worsened two years ago. The chief complaint is bilateral knee pain. The diagnosis of advanced grade 4 osteoarthritis is supported by the plain X-ray findings, corresponding to ICD-10 code M17.0 for bilateral primary osteoarthritis. The history of illness is documented as five years of knee pain with recent worsening. Although the patient was given non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs and muscle relaxants, it is not specified if they are currently taking these medications. The imaging result shows advanced osteoarthritis. The current plan involves continuing physiotherapy exercises with a follow-up reassessment in two weeks.
